title: Linux Disk Space Full
description: Identify and clean up large files and logs on Linux when disk space is 100%.

steps.title: Identify Full Partition
steps.instruction: Run 'df -h'. Look for any partition at 100% usage (especially / or /var).

steps.title: Find Large Directories
steps.instruction: Run 'sudo du -sh /* | sort -h'. This shows you the size of all top-level directories to narrow down the problem.

steps.title: Clean Package Cache
steps.instruction: For Ubuntu/Debian: 'sudo apt clean'. For CentOS/RHEL: 'sudo yum clean all'. This removes old downloaded installers.

steps.title: Rotate Large Logs
steps.instruction: Check '/var/log'. If 'syslog' or 'journal' is huge, use 'sudo journalctl --vacuum-time=1d' to clear old logs.

steps.title: Check for Deleted but Open Files
steps.instruction: Run 'sudo lsof / | grep deleted'. If a process still has a large deleted file open, it won't free the space until you restart that process.
